intro: Hibbertia ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Hibbertia ligulata has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal regions of Western Australia.
